title: PHPUnit @group breaks when used in files with different line endings
body:
| Q                   | A
| --------------------| ---------------
| PHPUnit version     | 8.1.5 / 7.5.2
| PHP version         | 7.2.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 / PHP 7.2.11
| Installation Method | Composer

When having tests files with different line endings, phpunit will duplicate groups beetwen LF and CR, consider the following:
```php
<?php
// this file has mac line endings (\r)
namespace Test;

use PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase;

class MacLineEndTest extends TestCase
{
    /**
     * @group Foo
     */
    public function testGroup()
    {
    }
}
```

```php
<?php
// this file has linux line ending (\n)
namespace Test;

use PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase;

class UnixLineEndTest extends TestCase
{
    /**
     * @group Foo
     */
    public function testGroup()
    {
    }
}
```

```php
<?php
// this file has windows line endings (\r\n)

namespace Test;

use PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase;

class WindowsLineEndTest extends TestCase
{
    /**
     * @group Foo
     */
    public function testGroup()
    {
    }
}
```

If you run command: `phpunit --list-groups`, you will have output:
```
Available test group(s):
 - Foo
 - Foo
```

If you try to execute `phpunit --group Foo`, it will only execute tests with linux line endings, and Windows line ending:
```
PHPUnit 8.1.5 by Sebastian Bergmann and contributors.

RR                                                                  2 / 2 (100%)

Time: 28 ms, Memory: 4.00 MB

There were 2 risky tests:

1) Test\UnixLineEndTest::testGroup
This test did not perform any assertions

/var/workspace/phpunit-group-test/tests/UnixLineEndTest.php:17

2) Test\WindowsLineEndTest::testGroup
This test did not perform any assertions

/var/workspace/phpunit-group-test/tests/WindowsLineEndTest.php:17

OK, but incomplete, skipped, or risky tests!
Tests: 2, Assertions: 0, Risky: 2.
```
BTW, this was tested on linux host, result might be different on Mac.
